title: Trump Confirms Military Plan For Mass Deportation Of Undocumented Migrants
content: President-elect Donald Trump confirmed Monday that he plans to declare a national emergency on border security and use the US military to carry out a mass deportation of undocumented migrants.
summary: President-elect Donald Trump confirmed Monday that he plans to declare a national emergency on border security and use the US military to carry out a mass deportation of undocumented migrants.

title: Global South Impacted By Food, Fuel Crisis Amid Conflicts: PM Modi At G20
content: The countries of the Global South are most adversely impacted by the food, fuel and fertilizer crisis caused by global conflicts, and G20 must focus on addressing the challenges, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Monday.
summary: The countries of the Global South are most adversely impacted by the food, fuel and fertilizer crisis caused by global conflicts, and G20 must focus on addressing the challenges, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Monday.

title: Why Donald Trump's Cabinet Choices Are Giving Pakistan Sleepless Nights
content: Pakistan is keeping a very close watch on how Donald Trump's cabinet is shaping up as Islamabad is getting increasingly jittery over the decisions being made so far.
summary: Pakistan is keeping a very close watch on how Donald Trump's cabinet is shaping up as Islamabad is getting increasingly jittery over the decisions being made so far.

title: Israel To Target Hezbollah Despite Potential Lebanon Ceasefire: Netanyahu
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Monday that Israel will continue to operate militarily against the Iran-backed Lebanese armed movement Hezbollah even if a ceasefire deal is reached in Lebanon.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Monday that Israel will continue to operate militarily against the Iran-backed Lebanese armed movement Hezbollah even if a ceasefire deal is reached in Lebanon.

title: Meta Fined $25.4 Million By India, WhatsApp Data Sharing Blocked For 5 Years
content: India's competition watchdog directed WhatsApp to refrain from sharing user data for advertising purposes with other applications owned by Meta for a period of five years and fined the U.S. tech giant $25.4 million on Monday.
summary: India's competition watchdog directed WhatsApp to refrain from sharing user data for advertising purposes with other applications owned by Meta for a period of five years and fined the U.S. tech giant $25.4 million on Monday.

title: Why Peace In The Middle East Might Be Beyond Trump's Deal-Making Skills
content: Donald Trumps re-election as the US president last week comes at a time of extreme volatility in the Middle East.

title: At Least 62,000 Dead In Sudan's Civil War, Real Figure Might Be Far Higher
content: The ongoing war in Sudan has often been overlooked amid higher-profile conflicts raging across multiple continents.

title: Carrot Recall Announced Across US After E. Coli Outbreak In 18 States
content: Organic carrots and baby carrots sold in grocery stores across the United States are being recalled after an E. coli outbreak that has left at least one person dead and 15 others hospitalized.
summary: Organic carrots and baby carrots sold in grocery stores across the United States are being recalled after an E. coli outbreak that has left at least one person dead and 15 others hospitalized.

title: Dhaka, Islamabad Inch Closer With Historic Sea Link. How It Impacts India
content: A Pakistani cargo ship docked at Bangladeshs Chittagong port last week, marking the first-ever direct maritime contact between the two countries in over five decades. The vessel from Karachi has successfully unloaded its containers at the post.
summary: A Pakistani cargo ship docked at Bangladeshs Chittagong port last week, marking the first-ever direct maritime contact between the two countries in over five decades. The vessel from Karachi has successfully unloaded its containers at the post.

title: "Ready To Deliver On Common Understandings Between PM Modi-Xi": China
content: China said it stands ready to deliver on important common understandings reached between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chinese President Xi Jinping during the recent BRICS summit leading to a thaw in the relations frozen for over four years.
summary: China said it stands ready to deliver on important common understandings reached between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chinese President Xi Jinping during the recent BRICS summit leading to a thaw in the relations frozen for over four years.

title: Justin Trudeau Says 'Made Mistakes' On Immigration, Plans Big Change
content: In a recent video message, Trudeau stated that Canada's population has grown rapidly over the past two years, but this growth has also been accompanied by exploitation.

title: Expert Says Earth Is In Midst Of Sixth Great Extinction: "We Don't Have..."

title: Viral: As Elon Musk Laughs At Memes, Trump Asks Him To Focus On UFC Match

title: Ocean Plankton Survived Ice Age But May Not Cope With Climate Change Now
content: In our new research, published today in Nature, we explored the ability of tiny marine organisms called plankton to adapt to global warming.

title: Explained: How Trump May Bypass Senate To Install His Cabinet Picks
content: President-elect Donald Trump has said he might install his picks for top administration posts without first winning approval in the U.S. Senate. This would erode the power of Congress and remove a significant check on his authority as president.
summary: President-elect Donald Trump has said he might install his picks for top administration posts without first winning approval in the U.S. Senate. This would erode the power of Congress and remove a significant check on his authority as president.

title: Woman-Run Cafe In Indonesia's Conservative Sharia Stronghold Shakes Stigma
content: In what claims to be the only woman-run cafe in the capital of Indonesia's most conservative province, owner Qurrata Ayuni says she and her baristas provide an alternative to rowdy, smoke-filled male haunts.
summary: In what claims to be the only woman-run cafe in the capital of Indonesia's most conservative province, owner Qurrata Ayuni says she and her baristas provide an alternative to rowdy, smoke-filled male haunts.
